Now many have undertaken to compile an account of the things that have been ful-filled among us,
undefined like the accounts passed on to us by those who were eyewitnesses and servants of the word from the beginning.
undefined So it seemed good to me as well, because I have followed all things carefully from the beginning, to write an orderly account for you, most excellent Theophilus,
undefined so that you may know for certain the things you were taught. Birth Announcement of John the Baptist

undefined During the reign of Herod king of Ju-dea, there lived a priest named Zechariah who belonged to the priestly division of Abijah, and he had a wife named Elizabeth, who was a descendant of Aaron.
undefined They were both righteous in the sight of God, following all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blamelessly.
undefined But they did not have a child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they were both very old.
undefined Now while Zechariah was serving as priest before God when his division was on duty,
undefined he was chosen by lot, according to the custom of the priesthood, to enter the holy place of the Lord and burn incense.
undefined Now the whole crowd of people were praying out-side at the hour of the incense offering.
undefined An angel of the Lord, standing on the right side of the altar of incense, appeared to him.
undefined And Zechariah, visibly shaken when he saw the angel, was seized with fear.
undefined But the angel said to him, “Do not be afraid, Zech-ariah, for your prayer has been heard, and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son; you will name him John.
undefined Joy and gladness will come to you, and many will rejoice at his birth,
undefined for he will be great in the sight of the Lord. He must never drink wine or strong drink, and he will be filled with the Holy Spir-it, even before his birth.
undefined He will turn many of the people of Israel to the Lord their God.

undefined And he will go as forerunner before the Lord in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers back to their children and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just, to make ready for the Lord a people prepared for him.”
undefined Zechariah said to the angel, “How can I be sure of this? For I am an old man, and my wife is old as well.”
undefined The angel answered him, “I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God, and I was sent to speak to you and to bring you this good news.
undefined And now, be-cause you did not believe my words, which will be fulfilled in their time, you will be silent, unable to speak, until the day these things take place.”
undefined Now the people were waiting for Zechariah, and they began to wonder why he was delayed in the holy place.
undefined When he came out, he was not able to speak to them. They realized that he had seen a vision in the holy place, because he was making signs to them and remained unable to speak.
undefined When his time of service was over, he went to his home.
undefined After some time his wife Elizabeth became pregnant, and for five months she kept herself in seclusion. She said,
undefined “This is what the Lord has done for me at the time when he has been gracious to me, to take away my disgrace among people.”Birth Announcement of Jesus the Messiah
undefined In the sixth month of Elizabeth’s pregnancy, the angel Gabriel was sent by God to a town of Galilee called Nazareth,
undefined to a virgin engaged to a man whose name was Jo-seph, a descendant of David, and the virgin’s name was Mary.
undefined The angel came to her and said, “Greetings, favored one, the Lord is with you!”
undefined But she was greatly troubled by his words and began to wonder about the meaning of this greeting.
undefined So the angel said to her, “Do not be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God!
undefined Listen: You will become pregnant and give birth to a son, and you will name him Jesus.
undefined He will be great, and will be called the Son of the Most High, and the Lord God will give him the throne of his father David.
undefined He will reign over the house of Jacob forever, and his king-dom will never end.”
undefined Mary said to the angel, “How will this be, since I have not had sexual relations with a man?”
undefined The angel replied, “The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will over-shadow you. Therefore the child to be born will be holy; he will be called the Son of God.
undefined “And look, your relative Elizabeth has also become pregnant with a son in her old age – although she was called barren, she is now in her sixth month!
undefined For nothing will be im-possible with God.”
undefined So Mary said, “Yes, I am a servant of the Lord; let this happen to me according to your word.” Then the angel de-parted from her.Mary and Elizabeth
undefined In those days Mary got up and went hurriedly into the hill country, to a town of Judah,
undefined and entered Zechariah’s house and greeted Elizabeth.
undefined When Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, the baby leaped in her womb, and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.
undefined She exclaimed with a loud voice, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the child in your womb!
undefined And who am I that the mother of my Lord should come and visit me?
undefined For the instant the sound of your greeting reached my ears, the baby in my womb leaped for joy.
undefined And blessed is she who believed that what was spoken to her by the Lord would be fulfilled.”Mary’s Hymn of Praise
undefined And Mary said,“My soul exalts the Lord,
undefined and my spirit has begun to rejoice in God my Savior,
undefined because he has looked upon the humble state of his servant.For from now on all generations will call me blessed,
undefined because he who is mighty has done great things for me, and holy is his name;
undefined from generation to generation he is merciful to those who fear him.
undefined He has demonstrated power with his arm; he has scattered those whose pride wells up from the sheer arrogance of their hearts.
undefined He has brought down the mighty from their thrones, and has lifted up those of lowly position;
undefined he has filled the hungry with good things, and has sent the rich away empty.
undefined He has helped his servant Israel, remembering his mercy,
undefined as he promised to our ancestors, to Abraham and to his descendants forever.”
undefined So Mary stayed with Elizabeth about three months and then returned to her home.The Birth of John
undefined Now the time came for Elizabeth to have her baby, and she gave birth to a son.
undefined Her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had shown great mercy to her, and they rejoiced with her.
undefined On the eighth day they came to cir-cumcise the child, and they wanted to name him Zechariah after his father.
undefined But his mother replied, “No! He must be named John.”
undefined They said to her, “But none of your relatives bears this name.”
undefined So they made signs to the baby’s father, inquiring what he wanted to name his son.
undefined He asked for a writing tablet and wrote, “His name is John.” And they were all amazed.
undefined Immediately Zechariah’s mouth was opened and his tongue released, and he spoke, blessing God.
undefined All their neighbors were filled with fear, and throughout the entire hill country of Judea all these things were talked about.
undefined All who heard these things kept them in their hearts, saying, “What then will this child be?” For the Lord’s hand was indeed with him.Zechariah’s Praise and Prediction
undefined Then his father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied,
undefined “Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, because he has come to help and has redeemed his people.
undefined For he has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David,
undefined as he spoke through the mouth of his holy prophets from long ago,
undefined that we should be saved from our enemies,and from the hand of all who hate us.
undefined He has done this to show mercy to our ancestors,and to remember his holy covenant –
undefined the oath that he swore to our ancestor Abraham. This oath grants
undefined that we, being rescued from the hand of our enemies,may serve him without fear,
undefined in holiness and righteousness before him for as long as we live.
undefined And you, child, will be called the prophet of the Most High.For you will go before the Lord to prepare his ways,
undefined to give his people knowledge of salvation through the forgiveness of their sins.
undefined Because of our God’s tender mercythe dawn will break upon us from on high
undefined to give light to those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death,to guide our feet into the way of peace.”
undefined And the child kept growing and be-coming strong in spirit, and he was in the wil-derness until the day he was revealed to Israel.The Census and the Birth of Jesus
Now in those days a decree went out from Caesar Augustus to register all the empire for taxes.
undefined This was the first registration, taken when Quirinius was governor of Syria.
undefined Everyone went to his own town to be reg-istered.
undefined So Joseph also went up from the town of Nazareth in Galilee to Judea, to the city of David called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and family line of David.
undefined He went to be registered with Mary, who was promised in marriage to him, and who was expecting a child.
undefined While they were there, the time came for her to deliver her child.
undefined And she gave birth to her firstborn son and wrapped him in strips of cloth and laid him in a manger, because there was no place for them in the inn.The Shepherds’ Visit
undefined Now there were shepherds nearby liv-ing out in the field, keeping guard over their flock at night.
undefined An angel of the Lord ap-peared to them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were absolutely terrified.
undefined But the angel said to them, “Do not be afraid! Listen carefully, for I proclaim to you good news that brings great joy to all the people:
undefined Today your Savior is born in the city of David. He is Christ the Lord.
undefined This will be a sign for you: You will find a baby wrapped in strips of cloth and lying in a manger.”
undefined Suddenly a vast, heavenly army appeared with the angel, praising God and saying,
undefined “Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace among people with whom he is pleased!”

undefined When the angels left them and went back to heaven, the shepherds said to one an-other, “Let us go over to Bethlehem and see this thing that has taken place, that the Lord has made known to us.”
undefined So they hurried off and located Mary and Joseph, and found the baby lying in a manger.
undefined When they saw him, they related what they had been told about this child,
undefined and all who heard it were astonished at what the shepherds said.
undefined But Mary treasured up all these words, pon-dering in her heart what they might mean.
undefined So the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all they had heard and seen; everything was just as they had been told.
undefined At the end of eight days, when he was circumcised, he was named Jesus, the name given by the angel before he was con-ceived in the womb.Jesus’ Presentation at the Temple
undefined Now when the time came for their pu-rification according to the law of Moses, Jo-seph and Mary brought Jesus up to Jerusalem to present him to the Lord
undefined (just as it is written in the law of the Lord, “Every firstborn male will be set apart to the Lord”),
undefined and to offer a sacrifice according to what is specified in the law of the Lord, a pair of doves or two young pigeons.The Prophecy of Simeon
undefined Now there was a man in Jerusalem named Simeon who was righteous and devout, looking for the restoration of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him.
undefined It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he would not die before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.
undefined So Simeon, directed by the Spirit, came into the temple courts, and when the parents brought in the child Jesus to do for him what was customary according to the law,
undefined Simeon took him in his arms and blessed God, saying,
undefined “Now, according to your word, Sovereign Lord, permit your servant to depart in peace.
undefined For my eyes have seen your salvation
undefined that you have prepared in the presence of all peoples:
undefined a light,for revelation to the Gentiles, and for glory to your people Israel.”
undefined So the child’s father and mother were amazed at what was said about him.

undefined Then Simeon blessed them and said to his mother Mary, “Listen carefully: This child is destined to be the cause of the falling and 	rising of many in Israel and to be a sign that will be rejected.
undefined Indeed, as a result of him the thoughts of many hearts will be revealed – and a sword will pierce your own soul as well!” The Testimony of Anna
undefined There was also a prophetess, Anna the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was very old, having been married to her hus-band for seven years until his death.
undefined She had lived as a widow since then for eighty-four years. She never left the temple, worship-ing with fasting and prayer night and day.
undefined At that moment, she came up to them and began to give thanks to God and to speak about the child to all who were waiting for the redemption of Jerusalem.
undefined So when Joseph and Mary had per-formed everything according to the law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee, to their own town of Nazareth.
undefined And the child grew and became strong, filled with wisdom, and the favor of God was upon him.Jesus in the Temple
undefined Now Jesus’ parents went to Jerusalem every year for the feast of the Passover.
undefined When he was twelve years old, they went up according to custom.
undefined But when the feast was over, as they were returning home, the boy Jesus stayed behind in 	Jerusalem. His parents did not know it,
undefined but (because they assumed that he was in their group of travelers) they went a day’s journey. Then they began to look for him among their relatives and acquaintances.
undefined When they did not find him, they returned to Jerusalem to look for him.
undefined After three days they found him in the temple courts, sitting among the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions.
undefined And all who heard Jesus were astonished at his understanding and his an-swers.
undefined When his parents saw him, they were overwhelmed. His mother said to him, “Child, why have you treated us like this? Look, your father and I have been looking for you anxiously.”
undefined But he replied, “Why were you looking for me? Didn’t you know that I must be in my Father’s house?”
undefined Yet his parents did not understand the remark he made to them.
undefined Then he went down with them and came to Nazareth, and was obedient to them. But his mother kept all these things in her heart.
undefined And Jesus increased in wisdom and in stature, and in favor with God and with peo-ple. The Ministry of John the Baptist

In the fifteenth year of the reign of Ti-berius Caesar, when Pontius Pilate was gover-nor of Judea, and Herod was tetrarch of Gali-lee, and his brother Philip was tetrarch of the region of Iturea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias was tetrarch of Abilene,
undefined during the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John the son of Zechariah in the wilderness.
undefined He went into all the region around the Jordan River, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
undefined As it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet, “The voice of one shouting in the wilderness:‘Prepare the way for the Lord, make his paths straight.
undefined Every valley will be filled,and every mountain and hill will be brought low, and the crooked will be made straight, and the rough ways will be made smooth,
undefined and all humanity will see the salvation of God.’”
undefined So John said to the crowds that came out to be baptized by him, “You offspring of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the com-ing wrath?

undefined Therefore produce fruit that proves your repentance, and don’t begin to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our fa-ther.’ For I tell you that God can raise up chil-dren for Abraham from these stones!
undefined Even now the ax is laid at the root of the trees, and every tree that does not produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.”
undefined So the crowds were asking him, “What then should we do?”
undefined John an-swered them, “The person who has two tunics must share with the person who has none, and the person who has food must do likewise.”
undefined Tax collectors also came to be baptized, and they said to him, “Teacher, what should we do?”
undefined He told them, “Collect no more than you are required to.”
undefined Then some sol-diers also asked him, “And as for us – what should we do?” He told them, “Take money from no one by violence or by false accusation, and be content with your pay.”
undefined While the people were filled with an-ticipation and they all wondered whether per-haps John could be the Christ,

undefined John an-swered them all, “I baptize you with water, 	but one more powerful than I am is coming – I am not worthy to untie the strap of his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
undefined His winnowing fork is in his hand to clean out his threshing floor and to gather the wheat into his storehouse, but the chaff he will burn up with inextinguishable fire.”
undefined And in this way, with many other ex-hortations, John proclaimed good news to the people.
undefined But when John rebuked Herod the tetrarch because of Herodias, his brother’s 	wife, and because of all the evil deeds that he had done,
undefined Herod added this to them all: He locked up John in prison.The Baptism of Jesus
undefined Now when all the people were bap-tized, Jesus also was baptized. And while he was praying, the heavens opened,
undefined and the Holy Spirit descended on him in bodily form like a dove. And a voice came from heaven, “You are my one dear Son; in you I take great delight.”The Genealogy of Jesus
undefined So Jesus, when he began his ministry, was about thirty years old. He was the son (as was supposed) of Joseph, the son of Heli,
undefined the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,
undefined the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,
undefined the son of Maath, the son of Mat-tathias, the son of Semein, the son of Josech, the son of Joda,
undefined the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,
undefined the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmadam, the son of Er,
undefined the son of Joshua, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,
undefined the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonam, the son of Eli-akim,
undefined the son of Melea, the son of Menna, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,
undefined the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Sala, the son of Nahshon,
undefined the son of Amminadab, the son of Admin, the son of Arni, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,
undefined the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Na-hor,
undefined the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,
undefined the son of Cainan, the son of Ar-phaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,
undefined the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalalel, the son of Kenan,
undefined the son of Enosh, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.The Temptation of Jesus
Then Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, re-turned from the Jordan River and was led by the Spirit in the wilderness,
undefined where for forty days he endured temptations from the devil. He ate nothing during those days, and when they were completed, he was famished.
undefined The devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, command this stone to become bread.”
undefined Jesus answered him, “It is written, ‘Man does not live by bread alone.’”
undefined Then the devil led him up to a high place and showed him in a flash all the king-doms of the world.
undefined And he said to him, “To you I will grant this whole realm – and the glory that goes along with it, for it has been relinquished to me, and I can give it to anyone I wish.
undefined So then, if you will worship me, all this will be yours.”
undefined Jesus answered him, “It is written, ‘You are to worship the Lord your God and serve only him.’”
undefined Then the devil brought him to Jerusa-lem, had him stand on the highest point of the temple, and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down from here,
undefined for it is written, ‘He will command his angels concerning you, to protect you,’
undefined and ‘with their hands they will lift you up, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.’”
undefined Jesus answered him, “It is said, ‘You are not to put the Lord your God to the test.’”
undefined So when the devil had completed every temp-tation, he departed from him until a more op-portune time.The Beginning of Jesus’ Ministry in Galilee
undefined Then Jesus, in the power of the Spirit, returned to Galilee, and news about him spread throughout the surrounding country-side.
undefined He began to teach in their syna-gogues and was praised by all. Rejection at Nazareth
undefined Now Jesus came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up, and went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day, as was his custom. He stood up to read,
undefined and the scroll of the prophet Isaiah was given to him. He unrolled the scroll and found the place where it was written,

undefined “The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he has anointed me to proclaim good news to the poor.He has sent me to proclaim release to the captives and the regaining of sight to the blind,to set free those who are oppressed,
undefined to proclaim the year of the Lord’s favor.”
undefined Then he rolled up the scroll, gave it back to the attendant, and sat down. The eyes of everyone in the synagogue were fixed on him.
undefined Then he began to tell them, “Today this scripture has been fulfilled even as you heard it being read.”
undefined All were speaking well of him, and were amazed at the gracious words coming out of his mouth. They said, “Isn’t this Joseph’s son?”
undefined Jesus said to them, “No doubt you will quote to me the proverb, ‘Physician, heal yourself!’ and say, ‘What we have heard that you did in Caperna-um, do here in your hometown too.’”
undefined And he added, “I tell you the truth, no prophet is acceptable in his hometown.
undefined But in truth I tell you, there were many widows in Israel in Elijah’s days, when the sky was shut up three and a half years, and there was a great famine over all the land.
undefined Yet Elijah was sent to none of them, but only to a woman who was a widow at Zarephath in Sidon.
undefined And there were many lepers in Israel in the time of the prophet Elisha, yet none of them was cleansed except Naaman the Syrian.”
undefined When they heard this, all the people in the synagogue were filled with rage.
undefined They got up, forced him out of the town, and brought him to the brow of the hill on which their town was built, so that they could throw him down the cliff.
undefined But he passed through the crowd and went on his way.Ministry in Capernaum
undefined So he went down to Capernaum, a town in Galilee, and on the Sabbath he began to teach the people.
undefined They were amazed at his teaching, because he spoke with authority.
undefined Now in the synagogue there was a man who had the spirit of an unclean demon, and he cried out with a loud voice,
undefined “Ha! Leave us alone, Jesus the Nazarene! Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are – the Holy One of God.”
undefined But Jesus rebuked him: “Silence! Come out of him!” Then, after the demon threw the man down in their midst, he came out of him without hurting him.
undefined They were all amazed and began to say to one another, “What’s happening here? For with authority and power he commands the unclean spirits, and they come out!”
undefined So the news about him spread into all areas of the region.
undefined After Jesus left the synagogue, he en-tered Simon’s house. Now Simon’s mother-in-law was suffering from a high fever, and they asked Jesus to help her.
undefined So he stood over her, commanded the fever, and it left her. Im-mediately she got up and began to serve them.
undefined As the sun was setting, all those who had any relatives sick with various diseases brought them to Jesus. He placed his hands on every one of them and healed them.
undefined De-mons also came out of many, crying out, “You are the Son of God!” But he rebuked them, and would not allow them to speak, because they knew that he was the Christ.
undefined The next morning Jesus departed and went to a deserted place. Yet the crowds were seeking him, and they came to him and tried to keep him from leaving them.
undefined But Jesus said to them, “I must proclaim the good news of the kingdom of God to the other towns too, for that is what I was sent to do.”
undefined So he continued to preach in the synagogues of Ju-dea.The Call of the Disciples
Now Jesus was standing by the Lake of Gennesaret, and the crowd was pressing around him to hear the word of God.
undefined He saw two boats by the lake, but the fishermen had gotten out of them and were washing their nets.
undefined He got into one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to put out a little way from the shore. Then Jesus sat down and taught the crowds from the boat.
undefined When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon, “Put out into the deep water and lower your nets for a catch.”
undefined Simon answered, “Master, we worked hard all night and caught nothing! But at your word I will lower the nets.”
undefined When they had done this, they caught so many fish that their nets started to tear.
undefined So they mo-tioned to their partners in the other boat to come and help them. And they came and filled both boats, so that they were about to sink.
undefined But when Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, “Go away from me, Lord, for I am a sinful man!”
undefined For Peter and all who were with him were astonished at the catch of fish that they had taken,
undefined and so were James and John, Zebedee’s sons, who were Simon’s business partners. Then Jesus said to Simon, “Do not be afraid; from now on you will be catching people.”
undefined So when they had brought their boats to shore, they left everything and followed him. Healing a Leper

undefined While Jesus was in one of the towns, a man came to him who was covered with lepro-sy. When he saw Jesus, he bowed down with his face to the ground and begged him, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”
undefined So he stretched out his hand and touched him, saying, “I am willing. Be clean!” And immediately the leprosy left him.
undefined Then he ordered the man to tell no one, but command-ed him, “Go and show yourself to a priest, and bring the offering for your cleansing, as Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
undefined But the news about him spread even more, and large crowds were gathering together to hear him and to be healed of their illnesses.
undefined Yet Jesus himself frequently withdrew to the wilderness and prayed.Healing and Forgiving a Paralytic

undefined Now on one of those days, while he was teaching, there were Pharisees and teach-ers of the law sitting nearby (who had come from every village of Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem), and the power of the Lord was with him to heal.
undefined Just then some men showed up, carrying a paralyzed man on a stretcher. They were trying to bring him in and place him before Jesus.
undefined But since they found no way to carry him in because of the crowd, they went up on the roof and let him down on the stretcher through the roof tiles right in front of Jesus.
undefined When Jesus saw their faith he said, “Friend, your sins are for-given.”
undefined Then the experts in the law and the Pharisees began to think to themselves, “Who is this man who is uttering blasphemies? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
undefined When Jesus perceived their hostile thoughts, he said to them, “Why are you raising objec-tions within yourselves?
undefined Which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Stand up and walk’?
undefined But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins” – he said to the para-lyzed man – “I tell you, stand up, take your stretcher and go home.”
undefined Immediately he stood up before them, picked up the stretcher he had been lying on, and went home, glorify-ing God.
undefined Then astonishment seized them all, and they glorified God. They were filled with awe, saying, “We have seen incredible things today.” The Call of Levi; Eating with Sinners
undefined After this, Jesus went out and saw a tax collector named Levi sitting at the tax booth. “Follow me,” he said to him.
undefined And he got up and followed him, leaving every-thing behind.
undefined Then Levi gave a great banquet in his house for Jesus, and there was a large crowd of tax collectors and others sitting at the table with them.
undefined But the Pharisees and their experts in the law complained to his disciples, saying, “Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?”
undefined Jesus answered them, “Those who are well don’t need a physi-cian, but those who are sick do.
undefined I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners to re-pentance.”The Superiority of the New
undefined Then they said to him, “John’s disci-ples frequently fast and pray, and so do the disciples of the Pharisees, but yours continue to eat and drink.”
undefined So Jesus said to them, “You cannot make the wedding guests fast while the bridegroom is with them, can you?
undefined But those days are coming, and when the bridegroom is taken from them, at that time they will fast.”

undefined He also told them a para-ble: “No one tears a patch from a new garment and sews it on an old garment. If he does, he will have torn the new, and the piece from the new will not match the old.
undefined And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. If he does, the new wine will burst the skins and will be spilled, and the skins will be destroyed.
undefined Instead new wine must be poured into new wineskins.
undefined No one after drinking old wine wants the new, for he says, ‘The old is good enough.’”Lord of the Sabbath
Jesus was going through the grain fields on a Sabbath, and his disciples picked some heads of wheat, rubbed them in their hands, and ate them.
undefined But some of the Phar-isees said, “Why are you doing what is against the law on the Sabbath?”
undefined Jesus answered them, “Haven’t you read what David did when he and his companions were hungry –
undefined how he entered the house of God, took and ate the sacred bread, which is not lawful for any to eat but the priests alone, and gave it to his companions?”
undefined Then he said to them, “The Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath.”Healing a Withered Hand
undefined On another Sabbath, Jesus entered the synagogue and was teaching. Now a man was there whose right hand was withered.
undefined The experts in the law and the Pharisees watched Jesus closely to see if he would heal on the Sabbath, so that they could find a reason to accuse him.
undefined But he knew their thoughts, and said to the man who had the withered hand, “Get up and stand here.” So he rose and stood there.
undefined Then Jesus said to them, “I ask you, is it lawful to do good on the Sabbath or to do evil, to save a life or to destroy it?”
undefined After looking around at them all, he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” The man did so, and his hand was restored.
undefined But they were filled with mindless rage and began debating with one another what they would do to Jesus. Choosing the Twelve Apostles
undefined Now it was during this time that Jesus went out to the mountain to pray, and he spent all night in prayer to God.
undefined When morning came, he called his disciples and chose twelve of them, whom he also named apostles:
undefined Simon (whom he named Peter), and his broth-er Andrew; and James, John, Philip, Barthol-omew,
undefined Matthew, Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, Simon who was called the Zeal-ot,
undefined Judas the son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor. The Sermon on the Plain

undefined How can you say to your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck from your eye,’ while you yourself don’t see the beam in your own? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck from your brother’s eye.
undefined “For no good tree bears bad fruit, nor again does a bad tree bear good fruit,
undefined for each tree is known by its own fruit. For figs are not gathered from thorns, nor are grapes picked from brambles.

undefined A centurion there had a slave who was highly regarded, but who was sick and at the point of death.
undefined When the centurion heard about Jesus, he sent some Jewish elders to him, ask-ing him to come and heal his slave.

undefined The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Look at him, a glutton and a drunk, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’

undefined Now one of the Pharisees asked Jesus to have dinner with him, so he went into the Pharisee’s house and took his place at the ta-ble.

Some time afterward he went on through towns and villages, preaching and proclaiming the good news of the kingdom of God. The twelve were with him,
undefined and also some women who had been healed of evil spirits and disabilities: Mary (called Magda-lene), from whom seven demons had gone out,
undefined and Joanna the wife of Cuza (Herod’s household manager), Susanna, and many oth-ers who provided for them out of their own resources.The Parable of the Sower
undefined While a large crowd was gathering and people were coming to Jesus from one town after another, he spoke to them in a parable:
undefined “A sower went out to sow his seed. And as he sowed, some fell along the path and was trampled on, and the wild birds devoured it.
undefined Other seed fell on rock, and when it came up, it withered because it had no moisture.
undefined Other seed fell among the thorns, and they grew up with it and choked it.

undefined Then his disciples asked him what this parable meant.

undefined Those on the rock are the ones who receive the word with joy when they hear it, but they have no root. They believe for a while, but in a time of testing fall away.

undefined But as for the seed that landed on good soil, these are the ones who, after hearing the word, cling to it with an honest and good heart, and bear fruit with steadfast endurance.Showing the Light

undefined For nothing is hidden that 	will not be revealed, and nothing concealed that will not be made known and brought to light.
undefined So listen carefully, for whoever has will be given more, but whoever does not have, even what he thinks he has will be taken from him.” Jesus’ True Family
undefined Now Jesus’ mother and his brothers came to him, but they could not get near him because of the crowd.
undefined So he was told, “Your mother and your brothers are standing outside, wanting to see you.”

undefined One day Jesus got into a boat with his disciples and said to them, “Let’s go across 	to the other side of the lake.” So they set out,

After this the Lord appointed seven-ty-two others and sent them on ahead of him two by two into every town and place where he himself was about to go.
undefined He said to them, “The harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few. Therefore ask the Lord of the harvest to send out workers into his harvest.

undefined Then Jesus turned to his disciples and said privately, “Blessed are the eyes that see what you see!
undefined For I tell you that many prophets and kings longed to see what you see but did not see it, and to hear what you hear but did not hear it.” The Parable of the Good Samaritan

undefined Give us each day our daily bread,
undefined and forgive us our sins, for we also forgive everyone who sins against us. And do not lead us into temptation.”
undefined Then he said to them, “Suppose one of you has a friend, and you go to him at mid-night and say to him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves of bread,
undefined because a friend of mine has stopped here while on a journey, and I have nothing to set before him.’
undefined Then he will reply from inside, ‘Do not bother me. The door is already shut, and my children and I are in bed. I cannot get up and give you anything.’

undefined I tell you, even though the man inside will not get up and give him anything because he is his friend, yet because of the first man’s sheer persistence he will get up and give him what-ever he needs.
undefined “So I tell you: Ask, and it will be giv-en to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and the door will be opened for you.
undefined For everyone who asks receives, and the one who seeks finds, and to the one who knocks, the door will be opened.
undefined What father among you, if your son asks for a fish, will give him a snake instead of a fish?
undefined Or if he asks for an egg, will give him a scorpion?
undefined If you then, although you are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will the heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him!”Jesus and Beelzebul
undefined Now he was casting out a demon that was mute. When the demon had gone out, the man who had been mute began to speak, and the crowds were amazed.
undefined But some of them said, “By the power of Beelzebul, the ruler of demons, he casts out demons.”
undefined Others, to test him, began asking for a sign from heaven.
undefined But Jesus, realizing their thoughts, said to them, “Every kingdom di-vided against itself is destroyed, and a divided household falls.
undefined So if Satan too is divid-ed against himself, how will his kingdom stand? I ask you this because you claim that I cast out demons by Beelzebul.
undefined Now if I cast out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.
undefined But if I cast out demons by the finger of God, then the kingdom of God has already overtaken you.
undefined When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own pal-ace, his possessions are safe.
undefined But when a stronger man attacks and conquers him, he takes away the first man’s armor on which the man relied and divides up his plunder.
undefined Whoever is not with me is against me, and whoever does not gather with me scatters.Response to Jesus’ Work
undefined “When an unclean spirit goes out of a person, it passes through waterless places look-ing for rest but not finding any. Then it says, ‘I will return to the home I left.’
undefined When it returns, it finds the house swept clean and put in order.
undefined Then it goes and brings seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they go in and live there, so the last state of that per-son is worse than the first.”
undefined As he said these things, a woman in the crowd spoke out to him, “Blessed is the womb that bore you and the breasts at which you nursed!”
undefined But he replied, “Blessed rather are those who hear the word of God and obey it!”The Sign of Jonah
undefined As the crowds were increasing, Jesus began to say, “This generation is a wicked generation; it looks for a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah.
undefined For just as Jonah became a sign to the people of Nineveh, so the Son of Man will be a sign to this generation.

undefined The queen of the South will rise up at the judgment with the people of this generation and condemn them, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon – and now, something greater than Solomon is here!

undefined The people of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because they repented when Jonah preached to them – and now, something greater than Jonah is here!Internal Light
undefined “No one after lighting a lamp puts it in a hidden place or under a basket, but on a lampstand, so that those who come in can see the light.
undefined Your eye is the lamp of your body. When your eye is healthy, your whole body is full of light, but when it is diseased, your body is full of darkness.
undefined Therefore see to it that the light in you is not darkness.
undefined If then your whole body is full of light, with no part in the dark, it will be as full of light as when the light of a lamp shines on you.”Rebuking the Pharisees and Experts in the Law
undefined As he spoke, a Pharisee invited Jesus to have a meal with him, so he went in and took his place at the table.
undefined The Pharisee was astonished when he saw that Jesus did not first wash his hands before the meal.
undefined But the Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and the plate, but inside you are full of greed and wickedness.
undefined You fools! Didn’t the one who made the outside make the inside as well?
undefined But give from your heart to those in need, and then everything will be clean for you.

undefined “But woe to you Pharisees! You give a tenth of your mint, rue, and every herb, yet you neglect justice and love for God! But you should have done these things without ne-glecting the others.
undefined Woe to you Phari-sees! You love the best seats in the synagogues and elaborate greetings in the marketplaces!
undefined Woe to you! You are like unmarked graves, and people walk over them without realizing it!”
undefined One of the experts in religious law answered him, “Teacher, when you say these things you insult us too.”

undefined But Jesus re-plied, “Woe to you experts in religious law as well! You load people down with burdens difficult to bear, yet you yourselves refuse to touch the burdens with even one of your fin-gers!
undefined Woe to you! You build the tombs of the prophets whom your ancestors killed.
undefined So you testify that you approve of the deeds of your ancestors, because they killed the prophets and you build their tombs!
undefined For this reason also the wisdom of God said, ‘I will send them prophets and apostles, some of whom they will kill and persecute,’
undefined so that this generation may be held accountable for the blood of all the prophets that has been shed since the beginning of the world,
undefined from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zecha-riah, who was killed between the altar and the sanctuary. Yes, I tell you, it will be charged against this generation.
undefined Woe to you ex-perts in religious law! You have taken away the key to knowledge! You did not go in yourselves, and you hindered those who were going in.”
undefined When he went out from there, the experts in the law and the Pharisees began to oppose him bitterly, and to ask him hostile questions about many things,
undefined plotting against him, to catch him in something he might say.Fear God, Not People

Meanwhile, when many thousands of the crowd had gathered so that they were trampling on one another, Jesus began to speak first to his disciples, “Be on your guard against the yeast of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
undefined Nothing is hidden that will not be re-vealed, and nothing is secret that will not be made known.
undefined So then whatever you have said in the dark will be heard in the light, and what you have whispered in private rooms will be proclaimed from the housetops.
undefined “I tell you, my friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body, and after that have nothing more they can do.
undefined But I will warn you whom you should fear: Fear the one who, after the killing, has authority to throw you into hell. Yes, I tell you, fear him!
undefined Aren’t five sparrows sold for two pen-nies? Yet not one of them is forgotten before God.
undefined In fact, even the hairs on your head are all numbered. Do not be afraid; you are more valuable than many sparrows.
undefined “I tell you, whoever acknowledges me before men, the Son of Man will also acknowledge before God’s angels.
undefined But the one who denies me before men will be denied before God’s angels.
undefined And every-one who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but the person who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
undefined But when they bring you be-fore the synagogues, the rulers, and the author-ities, do not worry about how you should make your defense or what you should say,
undefined for the Holy Spirit will teach you at that moment what you must say.” The Parable of the Rich Landowner
undefined Then someone from the crowd said to him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”
undefined But Jesus said to him, “Man, who made me a judge or arbitrator between you two?”
undefined Then he said to them, “Watch out and guard yourself from all types of greed, because one’s life does not consist in the abundance of his possessions.”
undefined He then told them a parable: “The land of a certain rich man produced an abundant crop,
undefined so he thought to himself, ‘What should I do, for I have nowhere to store my crops?’
undefined Then he said, ‘I will do this: I will tear down my barns and build bigger ones, and there I will store all my grain and my goods.
undefined And I will say to myself, “You have plenty of goods stored up for many years; relax, eat, drink, celebrate!”’
undefined But God said to him, ‘You fool! This very night your life will be demanded back from you, but who will get what you have prepared for your-self?’
undefined So it is with the one who stores up riches for himself, but is not rich toward God.”Exhortation Not to Worry
undefined Then Jesus said to his disciples, “Therefore I tell you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat, or about your body, what you will wear.
undefined For there is more to life than food, and more to the body than clothing.
undefined Consider the ravens: They do not sow or reap, they have no storeroom or barn, yet God feeds them. How much more valuable are you than the birds!
undefined And which of you by worrying can add an hour to his life?
undefined So if you cannot do such a very little thing as this, why do you worry about the rest?

undefined And if this is how God clothes the wild grass, which is here today and tomorrow is tossed into the fire to heat the oven, how much more will he clothe you, you people of little faith!
undefined So do not be overly concerned about what you will eat and what you will drink, and do not worry about such things.

undefined Sell your possessions and give to the poor. Provide yourselves purses that do not wear out – a treasure in heaven that never decreases, where no thief approaches and no moth destroys.
undefined For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.Call to Faithful Stewardship
undefined “Get dressed for service and keep your lamps burning;
undefined be like people wait-ing for their master to come back from the wedding celebration, so that when he comes and knocks they can immediately open the door for him.

undefined Blessed are those slaves whom their master finds alert when he returns! I tell you the truth, he will dress himself to serve, have them take their place at the table, and will come and wait on them!

undefined But understand this: If the owner of the house had known at what hour the thief was coming, he would not have let his house be broken into.

undefined Then Peter said, “Lord, are you tell-ing this parable for us or for everyone?”

undefined I tell you the truth, the master will put him in charge of all his possessions.
undefined But if that slave should say to himself, ‘My master is delayed in returning,’ and he begins to beat the other slaves, both men and women, and to eat, drink, and get drunk,
undefined then the master of that slave will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he does not foresee, and will cut him in two, and assign him a place with the unfaithful.

undefined “I have come to bring fire on the earth – and how I wish it were already kin-dled!
undefined I have a baptism to undergo, and how distressed I am until it is finished!
undefined Do you think I have come to bring peace on earth? No, I tell you, but rather division!
undefined For from now on there will be five in one household divided, three against two and two against three.

undefined Jesus also said to the crowds, “When you see a cloud rising in the west, you say at once, ‘A rainstorm is coming,’ and it does.
undefined And when you see the south wind blow-ing, you say, ‘There will be scorching heat,’ and there is.

undefined “And why don’t you judge for your-selves what is right?

undefined As you are going with your accuser before the magistrate, make an effort to settle with him on the way, so that he will not drag you before the judge, and the judge hand you over to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.
undefined I tell you, you will never get out of there until you have paid the very last cent!”A Call to Repent
Now there were some present on that occasion who told him about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacri-fices.
undefined He answered them, “Do you think these Galileans were worse sinners than all the other Galileans, because they suffered these things?
undefined No, I tell you! But unless you repent, you will all perish as well!
undefined Or those eighteen who were killed when the tow-er in Siloam fell on them, do you think they were worse offenders than all the others who live in Jerusalem?
undefined No, I tell you! But un-less you repent you will all perish as well!”Warning to Israel to Bear Fruit
undefined Then Jesus told this parable: “A man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, and he came looking for fruit on it and found none.

undefined So he said to the worker who tended the vineyard, ‘For three years now, I have come looking for fruit on this fig tree, and each time I inspect it I find none. Cut it down! Why should it continue to deplete the soil?’
undefined But the worker answered him, ‘Sir, leave it alone this year too, until I dig around it and put fertilizer on it.
undefined Then if it bears fruit next year, very well, but if not, you can cut it down.’”Healing on the Sabbath
undefined Now he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath,
undefined and a wom-an was there who had been disabled by a spirit for eighteen years. She was bent over and could not straighten herself up completely.
undefined When Jesus saw her, he called her to him and said, “Woman, you are freed from your infirmity.”
undefined Then he placed his hands on her, and immediately she straightened up and praised God.

undefined But the president of the synagogue, indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, said to the crowd, “There are six days on which work should be done! So come and be healed on those days, and not on the Sabbath day.”
undefined Then the Lord answered him, “You hypocrites! Does not each of you on the Sabbath untie his ox or his donkey from its stall, and lead it to water?
undefined Then shouldn’t this woman, a daughter of Abraham whom Satan bound for eighteen long years, be released from this imprisonment on the Sabbath day?”
undefined When he said this all his adversaries were humiliated, but the entire crowd was rejoicing at all the wonderful things he was doing.On the Kingdom of God
undefined Thus Jesus asked, “What is the king-dom of God like? To what should I compare it?
undefined It is like a mustard seed that a man took and sowed in his garden. It grew and became a tree, and the wild birds nested in its branches.”
undefined Again he said, “To what should I compare the kingdom of God?
undefined It is like yeast that a woman took and mixed with three measures of flour until all the dough had ris-en.”The Narrow Door
undefined Then Jesus traveled throughout towns and villages, teaching and making his way toward Jerusalem.
undefined Someone asked him, “Lord, will only a few be saved?” So he said to them,
undefined “Exert every effort to enter through the narrow door, because many, I tell you, will try to enter and will not be able to.

undefined Once the head of the house gets up and shuts the door, then you will stand outside and start to knock on the door and beg him, ‘Lord, let us in!’ But he will answer you, ‘I don’t know where you come from.’
undefined Then you will begin to say, ‘We ate and drank in your presence, and you taught in our streets.’
undefined But he will reply, ‘I don’t know where you come from! Go away from me, all you evildo-ers!’
undefined There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth when you see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all the prophets in the kingdom of God but you yourselves thrown out.
undefined Then people will come from east and west, and from north and south, and take their places at the banquet table in the kingdom of God.
undefined But indeed, some are last who will be first, and some are first who will be last.”Going to Jerusalem
undefined At that time, some Pharisees came up and said to Jesus, “Get away from here, be-cause Herod wants to kill you.”
undefined But he said to them, “Go and tell that fox, ‘Look, I am casting out demons and performing heal-ings today and tomorrow, and on the third day I will complete my work.
undefined Nevertheless I must go on my way today and tomorrow and the next day, because it is impossible that a prophet should be killed outside Jerusalem.’

undefined O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those who are sent to you! How often I have longed to gather your chil-dren together as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you would have none of it!
undefined Look, your house is forsaken! And I tell you, you will not see me until you say, ‘Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!’”Healing Again on the Sabbath
Now one Sabbath when Jesus went to dine at the house of a leader of the Pharisees, they were watching him closely.
undefined There right in front of him was a man suffering from dropsy.
undefined So Jesus asked the experts in reli-gious law and the Pharisees, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath or not?”
undefined But they remained silent. So Jesus took hold of the man, healed him, and sent him away.
undefined Then he said to them, “Which of you, if you have a son or an ox that has fallen into a well on a Sabbath day, will not immediately pull him out?”
undefined But they could not reply to this.On Seeking Seats of Honor
undefined Then when Jesus noticed how the guests chose the places of honor, he told them a parable. He said to them,
undefined “When you are invited by someone to a wedding feast, do not take the place of honor, because a person more distinguished than you may have been invited by your host.
undefined So the host who invited both of you will come and say to you, ‘Give this man your place.’ Then, ashamed, you will begin to move to the least important place.

undefined But when you are invited, go and take the least important place, so that when your host approaches he will say to you, ‘Friend, move up here to a better place.’ Then you will be honored in the presence of all who share the meal with you.
undefined For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but the one who humbles himself will be exalted.”

undefined He said also to the man who had in-vited him, “When you host a dinner or a ban-quet, don’t invite your friends or your brothers or your relatives or rich neighbors so you can be invited by them in return and get repaid.
undefined But when you host an elaborate meal, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, and the blind.
undefined Then you will be blessed, because they cannot repay you, for you will be repaid at the resurrection of the righteous.”The Parable of the Great Banquet
undefined When one of those at the meal with Jesus heard this, he said to him, “Blessed is everyone who will feast in the kingdom of God!”
undefined But Jesus said to him, “A man once gave a great banquet and invited many guests.
undefined At the time for the banquet he sent his slave to tell those who had been invit-ed, ‘Come, because everything is now ready.’
undefined But one after another they all began to make excuses. The first said to him, ‘I have bought a field, and I must go out and see it. Please excuse me.’
undefined Another said, ‘I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I am going out to examine them. Please excuse me.’
undefined Another said, ‘I just got married, and I cannot come.’

undefined So the slave came back and re-ported this to his master. Then the master of the household was furious and said to his slave, ‘Go out quickly to the streets and alleys of the city, and bring in the poor, the crippled, the blind, and the lame.’
undefined Then the slave said, ‘Sir, what you instructed has been done, and there is still room.’
undefined So the master said to his slave, ‘Go out to the highways and country roads and urge people to come in, so that my house will be filled.
undefined For I tell you, not one of those individuals who were invited will taste my banquet!’”Counting the Cost
undefined Now large crowds were accompany-ing Jesus, and turning to them he said,
undefined “If anyone comes to me and does not hate his own father and mother, and wife and children, and brothers and sisters, and even his own life, he cannot be my disciple.
undefined Whoever does not carry his own cross and follow me cannot be my disciple.
undefined For which of you, want-ing to build a tower, doesn’t sit down first and compute the cost to see if he has enough mon-ey to complete it?
undefined Otherwise, when he has laid a foundation and is not able to finish the tower, all who see it will begin to make fun of him.
undefined They will say, ‘This man began to build and was not able to finish!’

undefined Or what king, going out to confront another king in battle, will not sit down first and determine whether he is able with ten thousand to oppose the one coming against him with twenty thou-sand?
undefined If he cannot succeed, he will send a representative while the other is still a long way off and ask for terms of peace.
undefined In the same way therefore not one of you can be my disciple if he does not renounce all his own possessions.
undefined “Salt is good, but if salt loses its fla-vor, how can its flavor be restored?
undefined It is of no value for the soil or for the manure pile; it is to be thrown out. The one who has ears to hear had better listen!”The Parable of the Lost Sheep and Coin
Now all the tax collectors and sinners were coming to hear him.
undefined But the Phari-sees and the experts in the law were complain-ing, “This man welcomes sinners and eats with them.”
undefined So Jesus told them this parable:
undefined “Which one of you, if he has a hundred sheep and loses one of them, would not leave the ninety-nine in the open pasture and go look for the one that is lost until he finds it?
undefined Then when he has found it, he places it on his shoulders, rejoicing.
undefined Returning home, he calls together his friends and neighbors, telling them, ‘Rejoice with me, because I have found my sheep that was lost.’
undefined I tell you, in the same way there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous people who have no need to repent.
undefined “Or what woman, if she has ten silver coins and loses one of them, does not light a lamp, sweep the house, and search thoroughly until she finds it?
undefined Then when she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the coin that I had lost.’
undefined In the same way, I tell you, there is joy in the pres-ence of God’s angels over one sinner who repents.”The Parable of the Compassionate Father
undefined Then Jesus said, “A man had two sons.
undefined The younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me the share of the estate that will belong to me.’ So he divided his as-sets between them.
undefined After a few days, the younger son gathered together all he had and left on a journey to a distant country, and there he squandered his wealth with a wild lifestyle.
undefined Then after he had spent every-thing, a severe famine took place in that coun-try, and he began to be in need.
undefined So he went and worked for one of the citizens of that country, who sent him to his fields to feed pigs.
undefined He was longing to eat the carob pods the pigs were eating, but no one gave him anything.
undefined But when he came to his sens-es he said, ‘How many of my father’s hired workers have food enough to spare, but here I am dying from hunger!
undefined I will get up and go to my father and say to him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you.
undefined I am no longer worthy to be called your son; treat me like one of your hired workers.”’
undefined So he got up and went to his father. But while he was still a long way from home his father saw him, and his heart went out to him; he ran and hugged his son and kissed him.
undefined Then his son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you; I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’
undefined But the father said to his slaves, ‘Hurry! Bring the best robe, and put it on him! Put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet!
undefined Bring the fattened calf and kill it! Let us eat and celebrate,
undefined because this son of mine was dead, and is alive again – he was lost and is found!’ So they began to celebrate.
undefined “Now his older son was in the field. As he came and approached the house, he heard music and dancing.
undefined So he called one of the slaves and asked what was happen-ing.
undefined The slave replied, ‘Your brother has returned, and your father has killed the fat-tened calf because he got his son back safe and sound.’
undefined But the older son became angry and refused to go in. His father came out and appealed to him,

undefined but he an-swered his father, ‘Look! These many years I have worked like a slave for you, and I never disobeyed your commands. Yet you never gave me even a goat so that I could celebrate with my friends!
undefined But when this son of yours came back, who has devoured your as-sets with prostitutes, you killed the fattened calf for him!’
undefined Then the father said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and every-thing that belongs to me is yours.
undefined It was appropriate to celebrate and be glad, for your brother was dead, and is alive; he was lost and is found.’”The Parable of the Clever Steward
Jesus also said to the disciples, “There was a rich man who was informed of accusa-tions that his manager was wasting his assets.
undefined So he called the manager in and said to him, ‘What is this I hear about you? Turn in the account of your administration, because you can no longer be my manager.’
undefined Then the manager said to himself, ‘What should I do, since my master is taking my position away from me? I’m not strong enough to dig, and I’m too ashamed to beg.
undefined I know what to do so that when I am put out of manage-ment, people will welcome me into their homes.’
undefined So he contacted his master’s debtors one by one. He asked the first, ‘How much do you owe my master?’
undefined The man replied, ‘A hundred measures of olive oil.’ The manager said to him, ‘Take your bill, sit down quickly, and write fifty.’
undefined Then he said to another, ‘And how much do you owe?’ The second man replied, ‘A hundred measures of wheat.’ The manager said to him, ‘Take your bill, and write eighty.’
undefined The master com-mended the dishonest manager because he acted shrewdly. For the people of this world are more shrewd in dealing with their contem-poraries than the people of light.
undefined And I tell you, make friends for yourselves by how you use worldly wealth, so that when it runs out you will be welcomed into the eternal homes.
undefined “The one who is faithful in a very lit-tle is also faithful in much, and the one who is dishonest in a very little is also dishonest in much.
undefined If then you haven’t been trustwor-thy in handling worldly wealth, who will en-trust you with the true riches?
undefined And if you haven’t been trustworthy with someone else’s property, who will give you your own?

undefined No servant can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and money.” More Warnings about the Pharisees
undefined The Pharisees (who loved money) heard all this and ridiculed him.
undefined But Jesus said to them, “You are the ones who justify yourselves in men’s eyes, but God knows your hearts. For what is highly prized among men is utterly detestable in God’s sight.
undefined “The law and the prophets were in force until John; since then, the good news of the kingdom of God has been proclaimed, and everyone is urged to enter it.
undefined But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for one tiny stroke of a letter in the law to become void.
undefined “Everyone who divorces his wife and marries someone else commits adultery, and the one who marries a woman divorced from her husband commits adultery.The Rich Man and Lazarus
undefined “There was a rich man who dressed in purple and fine linen and who feasted sumptuously every day.
undefined But at his gate lay a poor man named Lazarus whose body was covered with sores,
undefined who longed to eat what fell from the rich man’s table. In ad-dition, the dogs came and licked his sores.
undefined “Now the poor man died and was carried by the angels to Abraham’s side. The rich man also died and was buried.
undefined And in hell, as he was in torment, he looked up and saw Abraham far off with Lazarus at his side.
undefined So he called out, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus to dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue, because I am in anguish in this fire.’
undefined But Abraham said, ‘Child, remember that in your lifetime you received your good things and Lazarus likewise bad things, but now he is comforted here and you are in anguish.
undefined Besides all this, a great chasm has been fixed between us, so that those who want to cross over from here to you cannot do so, and no one can cross from there to us.’
undefined So the rich man said, ‘Then I beg you, father – send Lazarus to my father’s house
undefined (for I have five brothers) to warn them so that they don’t come into this place of torment.’
undefined But Abraham said, ‘They have Moses and the prophets; they must respond to them.’
undefined Then the rich man said, ‘No, father Abraham, but if someone from the dead goes to them, they will repent.’
undefined He replied to him, ‘If they do not respond to Moses and the proph-ets, they will not be convinced even if some-one rises from the dead.’”Sin, Forgiveness, Faith, and Service
Jesus said to his disciples, “Stumbling blocks are sure to come, but woe to the one through whom they come!
undefined It would be better for him to have a millstone tied around his neck and be thrown into the sea than for him to cause one of these little ones to sin.
undefined Watch yourselves! If your brother sins, rebuke him. If he repents, forgive him.
undefined Even if he sins against you seven times in a day, and sev-en times returns to you saying, ‘I repent,’ you must forgive him.”
undefined The apostles said to the Lord, “In-crease our faith!”
undefined So the Lord replied, “If you had faith the size of a mustard seed, you could say to this black mulberry tree, ‘Be pulled out by the roots and planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.
undefined “Would any one of you say to your slave who comes in from the field after plow-ing or shepherding sheep, ‘Come at once and sit down for a meal’?
undefined Won’t the master instead say to him, ‘Get my dinner ready, and make yourself ready to serve me while I eat and drink. Then you may eat and drink’?
undefined He won’t thank the slave because he did what he was told, will he?

undefined Now on the way to Jerusalem, Jesus was passing along between Samaria and Gali-lee.
undefined As he was entering a village, ten men with leprosy met him. They stood at a dis-tance,
undefined raised their voices and said, “Je-sus, Master, have mercy on us.”

undefined Then Jesus said, “Were not ten cleansed? Where are the other nine?
undefined Was no one found to turn back and give praise to God except this for-eigner?”
undefined Then he said to the man, “Get up and go your way. Your faith has made you well.” The Coming of the Kingdom
undefined Now at one point the Pharisees asked Jesus when the kingdom of God was coming, so he answered, “The kingdom of God is not coming with signs to be observed,
undefined nor will they say, ‘Look, here it is!’ or ‘There!’ For indeed, the kingdom of God is in your midst.”The Coming of the Son of Man
undefined Then he said to the disciples, “The days are coming when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.
undefined Then people will say to you, ‘Look, there he is!’ or ‘Look, here he is!’ Do not go out or chase after them.

undefined Then the disciples said to him, “Where, Lord?” He replied to them, “Where the dead body is, there the vultures will gath-er.”Prayer and the Parable of the Persistent Widow
Then Jesus told them a parable to show them they should always pray and not lose heart.
undefined He said, “In a certain city there was a judge who neither feared God nor re-spected people.

undefined yet because this widow keeps on bothering me, I will give her justice, or in the end she will wear me out by her unending pleas.’”

undefined I tell you, he will give them justice speedily. Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on earth?”The Parable of the Pharisee and Tax Collector

undefined Now a man named Zacchaeus was there; he was a chief tax collector and was rich.

undefined So the king said to him, ‘And you are to be over five cities.’

Now one day, as Jesus was teaching the people in the temple courts and proclaim-ing the gospel, the chief priests and the experts in the law with the elders came up
undefined and said to him, “Tell us: By what authority are you doing these things? Or who it is who gave you this authority?”

undefined Then he began to tell the people this parable: “A man planted a vineyard, leased it to tenant farmers, and went on a journey for a long time.

undefined So he sent still a third. They even wounded this one, and threw him out.

undefined But when the tenants saw him, they said to one another, ‘This is the heir; let’s kill him so the inheritance will be ours!’
undefined So they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him. What then will the owner of the vineyard do to them?

undefined The second

undefined “But when you see Jerusalem sur-rounded by armies, then know that its desola-tion has come near.
undefined Then those who are in Judea must flee to the mountains. Those who are inside the city must depart. Those who are out in the country must not enter it,

undefined Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.Be Ready!
undefined “But be on your guard so that your hearts are not weighed down with dissipation and drunkenness and the worries of this life, and that day close down upon you suddenly like a trap.
undefined For it will overtake all who live on the face of the whole earth.
undefined But stay alert at all times, praying that you may have strength to escape all these things that must happen, and to stand before the Son of Man.”
undefined So every day Jesus was teaching in the temple courts, but at night he went and stayed on the Mount of Olives.
undefined And all the people came to him early in the morning to listen to him in the temple courts.Judas’ Decision to Betray Jesus
Now the Feast of Unleavened Bread, which is called the Passover, was approaching.
undefined The chief priests and the experts in the law were trying to find some way to execute Jesus, for they were afraid of the people.
undefined Then Satan entered Judas, the one called Iscariot, who was one of the twelve.
undefined He went away and discussed with the chief priests and officers of the temple guard how he might betray Jesus, handing him over to them.
undefined They were delighted and ar-ranged to give him money.
undefined So Judas agreed and began looking for an opportunity to betray Jesus when no crowd was present.The Passover
undefined Then the day for the feast of Unleav-ened Bread came, on which the Passover lamb had to be sacrificed.
undefined Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and prepare the Passover for us to eat.”
undefined They said to him, “Where do you want us to prepare it?”
undefined He said to them, “Listen, when you have entered the city, a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him into the house that he enters,
undefined and tell the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest room where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’
undefined Then he will show you a large furnished room upstairs. Make preparations there.”
undefined So they went and found things just as he had told them, and they prepared the Passover.The Lord’s Supper
undefined Now when the hour came, Jesus took his place at the table and the apostles joined him.

undefined For the Son of Man is to go just as it has been de-termined, but woe to that man by whom he is betrayed!”

undefined “You are the ones who have re-mained with me in my trials.
undefined Thus I grant to you a kingdom, just as my Father granted to me,
undefined that you may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom, and you will sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
undefined “Simon, Simon, pay attention! Satan has demanded to have you all, to sift you like wheat,
undefined but I have prayed for you, Simon, that your faith may not fail. When you have turned back, strengthen your brothers.”
undefined But Peter said to him, “Lord, I am ready to go with you both to prison and to death!”
undefined Jesus replied, “I tell you, Peter, the rooster will not crow today until you have denied three times that you know me.”
undefined Then Jesus said to them, “When I sent you out with no money bag, or traveler’s bag, or sandals, you didn’t lack anything, did you?” They replied, “Nothing.”
undefined He said to them, “But now, the one who has a money bag must take it, and likewise a traveler’s bag too. And the one who has no sword must sell his cloak and buy one.
undefined For I tell you that this scripture must be fulfilled in me, ‘And he was counted with the transgressors.’ For what is written about me is being fulfilled.”
undefined So they said, “Look, Lord, here are two swords.” Then he told them, “It is enough.”On the Mount of Olives
undefined Then Jesus went out and made his way, as he customarily did, to the Mount of Olives, and the disciples followed him.
undefined When he came to the place, he said to them, “Pray that you will not fall into temptation.”
undefined He went away from them about a stone’s throw, knelt down, and prayed,
undefined “Father, if you are willing, take this cup away from me. Yet not my will but yours be done.” [
undefined Then an angel from heaven appeared to him and strengthened him.
undefined And in his an-guish he prayed more earnestly, and his sweat was like drops of blood falling to the ground.]
undefined When he got up from prayer, he came to the disciples and found them sleeping, ex-hausted from grief.
undefined So he said to them, “Why are you sleeping? Get up and pray that you will not fall into temptation!”Betrayal and Arrest
undefined While he was still speaking, suddenly a crowd appeared, and the man named Judas, one of the twelve, was leading them. He walked up to Jesus to kiss him.
undefined But Jesus said to him, “Judas, would you betray the Son of Man with a kiss?”
undefined When those who were around him saw what was about to hap-pen, they said, “Lord, should we use our swords?”

undefined But Jesus said, “Enough of this!” And he touched the man’s ear and healed him.

undefined Then Jesus said to the chief priests, the officers of the temple guard, and the elders who had come out to get him, “Have you come out with swords and clubs like you would against an outlaw?
undefined Day after day when I was with you in the temple courts, you did not arrest me. But this is your hour, and that of the power of darkness!”Jesus’ Condemnation and Peter’s Denials
undefined Then they arrested Jesus, led him away, and brought him into the high priest’s house. But Peter was following at a distance.
undefined When they had made a fire in the middle of the courtyard and sat down together, Peter sat down among them.
undefined Then a slave girl, seeing him as he sat in the firelight, stared at him and said, “This man was with him too!”
undefined But Peter denied it: “Woman, I don’t know him!”
undefined Then a little later someone else saw him and said, “You are one of them too.” But Peter said, “Man, I am not!”
undefined And after about an hour still another insisted, “Certainly this man was with him, because he too is a Galilean.”
undefined But Peter said, “Man, I don’t know what you’re talking about!” At that moment, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.

undefined And he went outside and wept bitterly.
