undefined and if I ask you, you will not answer.
undefined But from now on the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.”
undefined So they all said, “Are you the Son of God, then?” He answered them, “You say that I am.”
undefined Then they said, “Why do we need further testimony? We have heard it our-selves from his own lips!”Jesus Brought Before Pilate
Then the whole group of them rose up and brought Jesus before Pilate.
undefined They began to accuse him, saying, “We found this man subverting our nation, forbidding us to pay the tribute tax to Caesar and claiming that he himself is Christ, a king.”
undefined So Pilate asked Jesus, “Are you the king of the Jews?” He replied, “You say so.”
undefined Then Pilate said to the chief priests and the crowds, “I find no basis for an accusation against this man.”
undefined But they persisted in saying, “He incites the people by teaching throughout all Judea. It started in Galilee and ended up here!”Jesus Brought Before Herod
undefined Now when Pilate heard this, he asked whether the man was a Galilean.
undefined When he learned that he was from Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him over to Herod, who also happened to be in Jerusalem at that time.
undefined When Herod saw Jesus, he was very glad, for he had long desired to see him, because he had heard about him and was hoping to see him perform some miraculous sign.
undefined So Herod ques-tioned him at considerable length; Jesus gave him no answer.
undefined The chief priests and the experts in the law were there, vehemently ac-cusing him.
undefined Even Herod with his soldiers treated him with contempt and mocked him. Then, dressing him in elegant clothes, Herod sent him back to Pilate.
undefined That very day Herod and Pilate became friends with each other, for prior to this they had been enemies.Jesus Brought Before the Crowd
undefined Then Pilate called together the chief priests, the rulers, and the people,
undefined and said to them, “You brought me this man as one who was misleading the people. When I exam-ined him before you, I did not find this man guilty of anything you accused him of doing.
undefined Neither did Herod, for he sent him back to us. Look, he has done nothing deserving death.
undefined I will therefore have him flogged and release him.”
undefined But they all shouted out together, “Take this man away! Release Barabbas for us!”
undefined (This was a man who had been thrown into prison for an insurrection started in the city, and for murder.)
undefined Pilate ad-dressed them once again because he wanted to release Jesus.
undefined But they kept on shouting, “Crucify, crucify him!”
undefined A third time he said to them, “Why? What wrong has he done? I have found him guilty of no crime deserving death. I will therefore flog him and release him.”
undefined But they were insistent, demanding with loud shouts that he be cruci-fied. And their shouts prevailed.
undefined So Pi-late decided that their demand should be granted.
undefined He released the man they asked for, who had been thrown in prison for insur-rection and murder. But he handed Jesus over to their will.The Crucifixion
undefined As they led him away, they seized Simon of Cyrene, who was coming in from the country. They placed the cross on his back and made him carry it behind Jesus.
undefined A great number of the people followed him, among them women who were mourning and wailing for him.
undefined But Jesus turned to them and said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.
undefined For this is certain: The days are coming when they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren, the wombs that never bore children, and the breasts that never nursed!’
undefined Then they will begin to say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ and to the hills, ‘Cover us!’
undefined For if such things are done when the wood is green, what will happen when it is dry?”
undefined Two other criminals were also led away to be executed with him.
undefined So when they came to the place that is called “The Skull,” they crucified him there, along with the criminals, one on his right and one on his left.
undefined [But Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they don’t know what they are doing.”] Then they threw dice to divide his clothes.
undefined The people also stood there watching, but the rulers ridiculed him, saying, “He saved others. Let him save himself if he is the Christ of God, his chosen one!”
undefined The soldiers also mocked him, coming up and offering him sour wine,
undefined and saying, “If you are the king of the Jews, save yourself!”
undefined There was also an inscription over him, “This is the king of the Jews.”
undefined One of the criminals who was hang-ing there railed at him, saying, “Aren’t you the Christ? Save yourself and us!”
undefined But the other rebuked him, saying, “Don’t you fear God, since you are under the same sentence of condemnation?
undefined And we rightly so, for we are getting what we deserve for what we did, but this man has done nothing wrong.”
undefined Then he said, “Jesus, remember me when you come in your kingdom.”
undefined And Jesus said to him, “I tell you the truth, today you will be with me in paradise.”
undefined It was now about noon, and darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon,
undefined because the sun’s light failed. The temple curtain was torn in two.
undefined Then Jesus, calling out with a loud voice, said, “Fa-ther, into your hands I commit my spirit!” And after he said this he breathed his last.
undefined Now when the centurion saw what had happened, he praised God and said, “Cer-tainly this man was innocent!”
undefined And all the crowds that had assembled for this specta-cle, when they saw what had taken place, re-turned home beating their breasts.
undefined And all those who knew Jesus stood at a distance, and the women who had followed him from Galilee saw these things. Jesus’ Burial
undefined Now there was a man named Joseph who was a member of the council, a good and righteous man.
undefined (He had not consented to their plan and action.) He was from the Judean town of Arimathea, and was looking forward to the kingdom of God.
undefined He went to Pi-late and asked for the body of Jesus.
undefined Then he took it down, wrapped it in a linen cloth, and placed it in a tomb cut out of the rock, where no one had yet been buried.
undefined It was the day of preparation and the Sabbath was beginning.
undefined The women who had accompanied Jesus from Galilee followed, and they saw the tomb and how his body was laid in it.
undefined Then they returned and prepared aromatic spices and perfumes. 	On the Sabbath they rested according to the commandment.The Resurrection
Now on the first day of the week, at early dawn, the women went to the tomb, taking the aromatic spices they had prepared.
undefined They found that the stone had been rolled away from the tomb,
undefined but when they went in, they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.
undefined While they were perplexed about this, suddenly two men stood beside them in dazzling attire.
undefined The women were terribly frightened and bowed their faces to the ground, but the men said to them, “Why do you look for the living among the dead?
undefined He is not here, but has been raised! Remember how he told you, while he was still in Galilee,
undefined that the Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and on the third day rise again.”
undefined Then the women remembered his words,
undefined and when they returned from the tomb they told all these things to the eleven and to all the rest.
undefined Now it was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the other women with them who told these things to the apos-tles.
undefined But these words seemed like pure nonsense to them, and they did not believe them.
undefined But Peter got up and ran to the tomb. He bent down and saw only the strips of linen cloth; then he went home, wondering what had happened.Jesus Walks the Road to Emmaus
undefined Now that very day two of them were on their way to a village called Emmaus, about seven miles from Jerusalem.
undefined They were talking to each other about all the things that had happened.
undefined While they were talking and debating these things, Jesus himself ap-proached and began to accompany them
undefined (but their eyes were kept from recognizing him).
undefined Then he said to them, “What are these matters you are discussing so intently as you walk along?” And they stood still, looking sad.
undefined Then one of them, named Cleopas, answered him, “Are you the only visitor to Jerusalem who doesn’t know the things that have happened there in these days?”

undefined He said to them, “What things?” “The things con-cerning Jesus the Nazarene,” they replied, “a man who, with his powerful deeds and words, proved to be a prophet before God and all the people;
undefined and how our chief priests and rulers handed him over to be condemned to death, and crucified him.
undefined But we had hoped that he was the one who was going to redeem Israel. Not only this, but it is now the third day since these things happened.
undefined Furthermore, some women of our group amazed us. They were at the tomb early this morning,
undefined and when they did not find his body, they came back and said they had seen a vision of angels, who said he was alive.
undefined Then some of those who were with us went to the tomb, and found it just as the women had said, but they did not see him.”
undefined So he said to them, “You foolish people – how slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken!
undefined Wasn’t it necessary for the Christ to suffer these things and enter into his glory?”
undefined Then beginning with Moses and all the prophets, he interpreted to them the things written about himself in all the scrip-tures.
undefined So they approached the village where they were going. He acted as though he want-ed to go farther,
undefined but they urged him, “Stay with us, because it is getting toward evening and the day is almost done.” So he went in to stay with them.
undefined When he had taken his place at the table with them, he took the bread, blessed and broke it, and gave it to them.
undefined At this point their eyes were opened and they recog-nized him. Then he vanished out of their sight.
undefined They said to each other, “Didn’t our hearts burn within us while he was speaking with us on the road, while he was explaining the scriptures to us?”
undefined So they got up that very hour and returned to Jerusalem. They found the eleven and those with them gath-ered together
undefined and saying, “The Lord has really risen, and has appeared to Simon!”
undefined Then they told what had happened on the road, and how they recognized him when he broke the bread.Jesus Makes a Final Appearance
undefined While they were saying these things, Jesus himself stood among them and said to them, “Peace be with you.”
undefined But they were startled and terrified, thinking they saw a ghost.
undefined Then he said to them, “Why are you frightened, and why do doubts arise in your hearts?
undefined Look at my hands and my feet; it’s me! Touch me and see; a ghost does not have flesh and bones like you see I have.”
undefined When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his feet.
undefined And while they still could not believe it (because of their joy) and were amazed, he said to them, “Do you have anything here to eat?”
undefined So they gave him a piece of broiled fish,
undefined and he took it and ate it in front of them.Jesus’ Final Commission

undefined Then he said to them, “These are my words that I spoke to you while I was still with you, that everything written about me in the law of Moses and the prophets and the psalms must be fulfilled.”
undefined Then he opened their minds so they could understand the scriptures,
undefined and said to them, “Thus it stands written that the Christ would suffer and would rise from the dead on the third day,
undefined and repentance for the forgiveness of sins would be proclaimed in his name to all nations, beginning from Jerusalem.
undefined You are witnesses of these things.
undefined And look, I am sending you what my Father promised. But stay in the city until you have been clothed with power from on high.”Jesus’ Departure
undefined Then Jesus led them out as far as Bethany, and lifting up his hands, he blessed them.
undefined Now during the blessing he de-parted and was taken up into heaven.
undefined So they worshiped him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,
undefined and were continually in the temple courts blessing God.
